node.title: 'My daughter died with hope': Children waiting for transplants suffering in Venezuela's political crises
node.alt: Woman holding a frame photo of her son, an urn with his ashes and a white rose
node.description: The South American country once had a successful transplant program, but now children are dying, waiting for life-changing surgery.
node.content:
["Zoe Martano is\u00a0six years old and no stranger to misery.", "She has spent half of her life in and out of a Venezuelan hospital, being prodded and poked, rushed to the ICU and hooked up to IV lines meant to keep her alive until her country's crises dissipate.", "Only then might the young leukaemia patient be able to undergo the bone marrow transplant doctors say\u00a0she desperately needs.", "Except for a few charity-aided cases, poor Venezuelan children have not received organ or bone marrow transplants since 2017.", "Only the wealthy in this socialist country can get transplants.", "For Andrea Vel\u00e1zquez, Zoe's mother, her daughter's life and the lives of more than 150 children awaiting transplants are in the hands of the government of President Nicol\u00e1s Maduro.", "\"If the resources were better managed, obviously, we would have better hospitals, and we would not be going through what we are going through.\"", "
Where\u00a0did it all go wrong?\u00a0
", "", "
Julieres Acevedo's four-year-old son Joshue died while waiting for a bone marrow transplant.(AP: Ariana Cubillos)
", "Between 1967 and 2000, more than 3,100 kidney procedures alone took place.", "By 2016, that number would more than double due to a public-private partnership that included public awareness campaigns, an organ procurement system and assistance for low-income patients.", "But after Mr Maduro took office following the death of president Hugo Chavez in 2013, the government demanded full control of the program.", "In June 2017, health officials told the country's 14 transplant centres that they would be closed for three months to resolve medication-related issues, but the service interruption became permanent.", "The country now lacks a program to harvest organs from dead people.\u00a0", "Even charitable options have been lost.\u00a0", "For years, the Houston-based Simon Bolivar Foundation, a charity funded by Citgo, a subsidiary of Venezuela\u2019s state-run oil giant PDVSA, covered the costs of transplants for Venezuelan children in other countries.", "But the foundation stopped paying the bills in 2019 after the US\u00a0imposed economic sanctions blocking companies from dealing with PDVSA.", "
Overwhelmed by the long wait\u00a0
", "Ms Vel\u00e1zquez works as an in-home hairdresser, taking appointments only when Zoe is not at the hospital.", "But Marcos Brito did not have a work-from-home option.", "He quit his job as a public school teacher in 2016 after his son was diagnosed with steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome.\u00a0", "Maykol Brito's condition typically progresses to end-stage kidney failure, but a transplant\u00a0would help him achieve remission.", "Since his diagnosis, he has\u00a0spent months in hospital, to the point his father calls it their home.", "At 13 years old, he understands the consequences of delaying transplants for younger patients.", "His father sometimes covers his ears when a nearby patient is having a medical crisis.", "\"It is important that transplants are reactivated for everyone.\"", "", "
\u00a0\u00c1ngel C\u00e9spedes\u00a0feels unwell for days after receiving his\u00a0dialysis to treat his condition.\u00a0(AP: Ariana Cubillos\u00a0)
", "Three times a week, 14-year-old \u00c1ngel C\u00e9spedes and his mother make a roughly 72-kilometre journey by bus from a rural community to Caracas.", "Yohelys C\u00e9spedes knows her son's pain all too well.", "She, too, has end-stage kidney failure, undergoes dialysis and needs a transplant.", "\u00c1ngel has relied on dialysis since he was diagnosed with chronic kidney disease in 2017.", "He has lost weight and is susceptible to fevers; his mother fears for his future and her own without transplants.", "\"This is not the time to look for someone to blame, whoever has the solution, that is what we want.\"", "", "
Yohelys C\u00e9spedes\u00a0 and her son\u00a0have been on dialysis for years, waiting\u00a0for kidney transplants.(AP: Ariana Cubillos)
", "
'Died with hope'
", "Children like nine-year-old Jeannys Herrera died waiting for a kidney transplant.\u00a0", "Her mother, Gineth Gil, periodically visits her grave at a municipal cemetery in Caracas, sweeping it with a makeshift hand broom and playing music for her daughter.", "", "
Gineth Gil visits the grave of her nine-year-old daughter Jeannys Herrera in Venezuela.\u00a0(AP: Ariana Cubillos)
", "In September, non-profit organisation Santi y sus Amigos proposed equipping an abandoned area of a hospital to exclusively provide bone marrow transplants -- a move it estimated could save at least 60 lives in less than a year.", "The organisation also suggested that the government enter into agreements with private Venezuelan hospitals that have the capacity to carry out paediatric transplants.", "", "
Shoes and the names of children who have died waiting for an organ transplant placed\u00a0by parents outside the Mexican embassy, in Caracas, Venezuela.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Ariana Cubillos)
", "But the negotiations \u2014\u00a0intended to find a way out of the years-long stalemate that has afflicted Venezuela \u2014 have\u00a0been delayed.\u00a0", "The Venezuelan government did not respond to requests for comment.", "Nicol\u00e1s Maduro announced a plan to resume bone marrow transplants during a televised\u00a0event.", "\"We are going to fully guarantee it with all the treatments, with all the loving care and overcoming difficulties, sanctions, blockade.\"", "AP/ABC\u00a0"]
